title: 34th Annual Tompkins Square Halloween Dog Parade
description: Join the 34th annual Tompkins Square Halloween Dog Parade, a festive event where dogs dress up in costumes and parade down Avenue A from 13th St to 7th St.
address: Avenue A from 13th St to 7th St

title: Third Annual Irving Square Park Howl-O-Ween Party
description: Celebrate Halloween at the Third Annual Irving Square Park Howl-O-Ween Party in Bushwick, featuring fun activities for dogs and their owners.

title: Sixth Annual Meatpacking Doggie Costume Contest
description: Join the Sixth Annual Meatpacking Doggie Costume Contest on Gansevoort Street, part of the 'Treats in the Streets' programming.

title: Carl Schurz Park Conservancy's Annual Halloween Howl + Healthy Hound Fair
description: Enjoy the Annual Halloween Howl and Healthy Hound Fair at Carl Schurz Park, featuring activities for dogs and their owners.
address: Basketball/Hockey Court + John Finley Walk, Yorkville

title: Free Hot Dogs + Vitaminwater
description: Enjoy free hot dogs and Vitaminwater at the New York Hot Dog King stand outside the Met Museum while supplies last.
address: 5th Ave + 82nd St, outside the Met Museum

title: Manhattan Vintage Clothing Show
description: Explore the Manhattan Vintage Clothing Show at the Metropolitan Pavilion, featuring a wide range of vintage clothing and accessories.

title: Third Annual National Indigenous Peoples of the Americas Parade
description: Join the Third Annual National Indigenous Peoples of the Americas Parade at Madison Square Park, celebrating Indigenous culture.

title: Diwali Times Square
description: Celebrate Diwali in Times Square with festivities and cultural performances along Broadway from 46th St to 48th St.

title: Dyckman Farmhouse Museum Fall Festival
description: Join the Fall Festival at Dyckman Farmhouse Museum in Inwood/Washington Heights, featuring family-friendly activities.

title: Halloween Pop-Up Market + Costume Contest
description: Visit the Halloween Pop-Up Market and Costume Contest at Caffeine Underground in Bushwick, featuring local vendors and fun activities.

title: Jersey City Night Market
description: Join the last Jersey City Night Market of the season at Journal Square, featuring local vendors and food.

title: NYC Artisanal Sweet Treats Bazaar
description: Explore the NYC Artisanal Sweet Treats Bazaar at 100 W 77th St at Columbus Ave, featuring local sweet treat vendors.
address: 100 W 77th St at Columbus Ave, UWS

title: BQ Flea Market
description: Visit the BQ Flea Market under the BQE along Meeker Ave between Union Ave and Lorimer St, featuring local vendors and crafts.
address: Under the BQE along Meeker Ave between Union Ave and Lorimer St, Williamsburg/Greenpoint

title: Annual Disability Pride Parade and Festival
description: Join the Annual Disability Pride Parade and Festival, starting at Broadway from Madison Square Park to Union Square Park, with a festival in Union Square Park.
address: Parade route: Broadway from Madison Square Park to Union Square Park

title: The Annual Elizabeth Foundation for the Arts Open Studios
description: Explore the Annual Elizabeth Foundation for the Arts Open Studios at the EFA Center in Midtown West, featuring local artists.

title: The Annual Art in Odd Places Festival
description: Join the Annual Art in Odd Places Festival along 14th Street from Avenue A to the Hudson River, featuring various art installations.
address: 14th Street from Avenue A to the Hudson River

title: MOMA PS1 Open House
description: Visit the MOMA PS1 Open House in LIC, featuring free admission and various art exhibits.

title: Fall 2024 Hunter College MFA + BFA Open Studios
description: Explore the Fall 2024 Hunter College MFA + BFA Open Studios at 205 Hudson Street in Tribeca, featuring student works.

title: 28th Annual Gowanus Open Studios
description: Join the 28th Annual Gowanus Open Studios at various locations, featuring local artists and their works.

title: The Annual Shock-A-Go-Go Film Fest
description: Enjoy the Annual Shock-A-Go-Go Film Fest at Film Noir Cinema in Greenpoint, featuring various horror films.

title: Pacific Island Film Festival
description: Join the Pacific Island Film Festival at various locations, showcasing films from the Pacific Islands.

title: Hitchquadtober
description: Enjoy classic Hitchcock films at Quad Cinema in Greenwich Village, part of the Hitchquadtober series.

title: 27th Reel Sisters of the Diaspora Film Festival + Lecture Series
description: Join the 27th Reel Sisters of the Diaspora Film Festival and Lecture Series at LIU, Center for Fiction, and Maysles Documentary Center.
address: LIU, Center for Fiction, Maysles Documentary Center

title: New Highline Art: Dinosaur
description: Visit the New Highline Art exhibition featuring Iván Argote's Dinosaur sculpture on the High Line at the Spur.
address: The High Line at the Spur on 30th Street and 10th Avenue

title: Ninth Annual Momenta Quartet Festival
description: Enjoy the Ninth Annual Momenta Quartet Festival at Broadway Presbyterian Church and Americas Society, featuring diverse chamber music programs.
address: Broadway Presbyterian Church, Washington Heights and Americas Society, UES

title: 22nd Annual Open House New York Weekend Festival
description: Explore 270+ locations across the five boroughs during the Open House New York Weekend Festival, featuring talks, tours, and behind-the-scenes access.
address: Various locations across the five boroughs

title: The New York Tattoo Convention
description: Join the New York Tattoo Convention at Duggal Greenhouse in Brooklyn Navy Yard, featuring tattoo artists, vendors, and performances.

title: Bryan Carter: Celebrating Bayard Rustin at Jazz at Lincoln Center
description: Experience a spirited tribute to Bayard Rustin led by Bryan Carter at Jazz at Lincoln Center, featuring a 35-piece orchestra.

title: Illuminated Sculptures of Woodlawn Walking Tour
description: Experience the eerie glow of Woodlawn Cemetery's mausoleums and sculptures during the walking tour, with flashlights provided.

title: Kweendom
description: Join the Kweendom LGBTQ+ comedy and storytelling show at Pete's Candy Store in Williamsburg, featuring various performers.

title: Dreamland Roller Disco
description: Enjoy themed skate parties at Prospect Park's LeFrak Center, with tonight's theme being Bowie vs Freddie.

title: Laugh It Off – A Comedy Show in a Dog Cafe
description: Join the Laugh It Off variety show at Boris and Horton in the East Village, where comedians tackle audience-submitted problems.

title: Best Night Ever Comedy Show and Party
description: Enjoy a night of live set recordings at the Best Night Ever Comedy Show at El Santo Taqueria in East Williamsburg/Bushwick.

title: A Paper Orchestra with Michael Jamin
description: Experience a one-man show by television writer Michael Jamin at Cloud City in Williamsburg, exploring the moments that shape us.
cost: $15 (select number of tickets available at $15, regular $30)

title: Bitches Brew Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a women-produced and hosted comedy show at Halyards in Gowanus, featuring various stand-up comedians.
cost: Free (tip jar will be passed around)

title: The Drunk Texts: Thou Wilt Scream
description: Celebrate spooky season with Shakespearean adaptations of Scream and Halloween at The Rat NYC in Dumbo.

title: The Midnight Troll 2 Riff Show
description: Join comedians for a running commentary on the cult classic Troll 2 at Littlefield in Gowanus.

title: Barbie: A Cultural Icon Exhibition
description: Visit the Barbie: A Cultural Icon exhibition at the Museum of Arts and Design, showcasing the history of Barbie and her impact on culture.
address: Museum of Arts and Design, Midtown West
cost: $20 general, $16 seniors, $14 students, half-price on Thursdays

title: Spooky + Gay: A Queer Horror Storytelling Cabaret
description: Join a queer horror storytelling variety show at The Vino Theater in East Williamsburg, featuring original scary stories and performances.

title: Back to the Future Day Screenings
description: Celebrate Back to the Future Day with special screenings of Back to the Future Part II at various locations.

title: Carpark Exhibition
description: Gaze upon classic and collector cars at the annual Carpark Exhibition outdoors at Fosun Plaza.

title: Tree Identification for Beginners
description: Join a local expert for a tree identification walk in Prospect Park, learning to identify trees by their details.

title: Marketplace Live!
description: Participate in a game show inspired by marketplace themes at Caveat in the Lower East Side, featuring comedians.

title: This Party is Killing You! The Robyn Party 2024: Robyn-O-Ween
description: Join the longest-running Robyn-themed party at 3 Dollar Bill in East Williamsburg, featuring DJs and a fun atmosphere.

title: The Astigmatism Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a comedy show hosted by bespectacled comedians at P+T Knitwear Bookstore in the Lower East Side.

title: New York Repertory Orchestra 2024-25 Season
description: Attend the New York Repertory Orchestra's concert featuring works by Mozart, Stravinsky, and Shaw at The Church of St. Mary the Virgin.
address: The Church of St. Mary the Virgin, Theater District

title: Scream II Tribute Show + Judy Jump Scare
description: Enjoy a drag double feature at C’mon Everybody in Bed-Stuy, featuring performances inspired by slasher flicks.

title: Aesop's Sound Fables Presents: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
description: Experience a live score performance to the silent film The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari at Pine Box Rock Shop in Bushwick.

title: The Fantasy Tavern: The Monster Manual Mash Edition
description: Join an interactive show and party at Caveat in the Lower East Side, featuring colorful characters and drinking songs.

title: Sandwich Comedy
description: Enjoy a comedy show at Union Hall in Park Slope, featuring comedians serving up freshly assembled material.

title: Free Bike Helmets
description: Get a free bike helmet at the Montague Street Open Streets event in Brooklyn Heights, while supplies last.
address: Montague Street Open Streets, Brooklyn Heights

title: Popography: Michael Jackson's 'Thriller'
description: Learn the moves from Michael Jackson's iconic 'Thriller' music video at Arlo Williamsburg's Mirror Bar.

title: Vocal Minorities Comedy Show
description: Enjoy a comedy show featuring a POC lineup at Union Hall in Park Slope.

title: Silent Book Club of Death + Death Cafe
description: Join a night dedicated to reading about death and discussing mortality at the Morbid Anatomy Library in Industry City.

title: New Tricks
description: Enjoy storytelling performances by those over 40 at Q.E.D. in Astoria.

title: Good God Comedy Show
description: Join a stand-up comedy variety show at Union Hall in Park Slope, where audience members share their secrets anonymously.

title: Beanie Babe Comedy
description: Enjoy a comedy show at Young Ethel's in Park Slope, where donations get you a vintage beanie baby to take home.

title: Disasterpiece Movie Night: Pass Thru
description: Join a watch party for the bad movie Pass Thru at Wonderville in Bushwick, complete with drinking games and trivia.

title: And Every One a Witch
description: Participate in an evening of piano karaoke and open mic performances at Club Cumming in the East Village.

title: Breaking the Binary Theatre Festival
description: Attend the Breaking the Binary Theatre Festival showcasing new work by transgender, non-binary, and two-spirit+ artists at Littlefield and Playwright Horizon's Peter Jay Sharp Theater.
address: Littlefield, Gowanus and Playwright Horizon's Peter Jay Sharp Theater, Hell's Kitchen

title: Classics in Black + White: Invasion of the Body Snatchers
description: Watch the classic film Invasion of the Body Snatchers at Cinema 123 by Angelika, part of a series of black and white classics.

title: Mourning and Adorning: Woven Hair Jewelry and Victorian Mourning Traditions
description: Join a panel discussion on Victorian mourning customs and jewelry culture at the Center for Brooklyn History.
address: Center for Brooklyn History, Brooklyn Heights

title: Louise Erdrich: The Mighty Red with Emma Straub
description: Attend the launch event for Louise Erdrich's latest novel at St. Ann and the Holy Trinity Church, hosted by Emma Straub.
address: St. Ann and the Holy Trinity Church, Brooklyn Heights
cost: $10 admission, $37 ticket includes a copy of the book

title: Live Dubbed Sitcoms: Halloween Special
description: Enjoy a Halloween special of live dubbed sitcoms at Caveat, featuring comedians improvising over classic TV episodes.
